creator: rofeco@btconnect.com
text:
I have installed a copy of this program, it acts as an http server fine, shows the website OK. However attempting to do an ftp transfer the server cannot be found.  Using a 'test your ftp server' from the web, the report is: 'server found, response incorrect' - the connection is dropped.  Which routine should be patched to correct this ?, do you have a patch list you could email to me ?.
Also the httpd file in config has a list of 'load module' directives, changing all to no hash caused a start error, this was traced to 'load module ssl_module modules/mod_ssl.so' causing the error. Checking the module folder, no .so routine is present, therefor no 'secure sockets layer' can be implemented.  Not currently required.
Please advise.
Regards,
Alan W. Roscoe MIET (Roscoe of Enfield Ltd.) 86, Kenilworth Crescent, Enfield, Middlesex, UK.  email: rofeco@btconnect.com (prefered)
tele: 0044 208 363 7069 + TAM.

This bugzilla is for reporting suspected bugs in Apache HTTP Server, not a support forum for questions, configuration assistance, support, or systems analysis.
  
Perhaps someone on the Apache HTTP Server users list can help you determine what's going on with your system, and if this due diligence points to an Apache HTTP Server bug, reopen this ticket with a rigorous description that illustrates (via verbatim error messages, configurations, logs, packet captures, etc) the misbehavior in Apache HTTP Server. 
 
http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html
creator: covener@gmail.com
